intro: Codonanthe hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's codonanthe, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
